Lectures were kinda boring, but he knows the text and gives real life examples.  Fairly easy class with online exams and don't need to go to class to get an A.

SEI.Subject: AEDECON
SEI.Class Name: Self-employment and Entrepreneurship in the Food, Agriculture, and Resource Sectors

summary_comment: The professor is highly knowledgeable and encourages active learning, making his classes engaging and valuable. However, his teaching effectiveness is questionable in large classes due to frequent tangents and unclear slides, and the grading system heavily weights assignments.

Ratings.comment: You can tell he is smart but he trails off a lot so it is real hard to hear. Also, a lot of his slides don't make sense or are simply one long sentence copied from the text. Really nice I just think he is bad at teaching large classes...also doesn't have enough points in the class so each assignment counts for a lot of your grade

Jeff is an excellent professor,the best thing SENR has to offer. He is so knowledgeable! This is my second time having Jeff and it keeps getting better. He really encourages students to learn and actively participate. Highly suggest taking Jeff.Tests are not too difficult, he wants to know if you understand the main points.

Go to classes. Movies shown in class have questions on midterms. He gives attendance points at random times. Very nice professor and knows what he's talking about. Text NOT necessary because his lectures are informative enough.

summary_comment: The professor is an outstanding lecturer and one of the top-rated precision agriculture specialists in the country, known for his deep knowledge and effective teaching methods. Students learn extensively during lab periods under his guidance.

Ratings.comment: Very good lecturer as he is one of the highest rated precision ag specialists in the country.  He is very knowledgeable and learned a lot about SMS during the lab period.

summary_comment: Professor Anderson's teaching quality is mixed; while he cares about clarifying concepts when asked, his lectures are often perceived as boring, leading many students to rely more on guest speakers who provide attendance points. The class heavily emphasizes midterms (best two out of three counted) and a significant group project.

Ratings.comment: 1/3 of the lectures were from guest speakers which are attendance points.  3 midterms in the class and best two were graded.  Group project was worth a lot of points also.  When Professor Anderson lectured he was very boring and most people didn't pay attention.  If you did ask a question he does care about making it clear for students.

summary_comment: Dr. Vickner is highly regarded as an excellent and knowledgeable professor, known for his no-nonsense approach and helpfulness. Students appreciate his clear explanations and logical teaching methods, though some note that his tough standards contribute to a rigorous yet rewarding learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Seemed like a really nice person, exams really weren't too difficult, if you've taken macro in high school then you should be fine for this class. Great professor!
One of the best professors I've ever had. He's no nonsense and down to business but he's a great guy and a fabulous teacher. Very helpful as well.

I took this class because I had heard it was easier. I don't think it's easier than the regular ECON 2001, when my friends took that class they had assignments that they got points for while this class was just 3 tests. That said Dr. Vickner is very helpful. You don't have to go to class if you read the book, and ask him for the book problems.

Dr. Vickner can easily be described as a hard ass, but to be honest, that´s why I liked him. I really appreciated his no-nonsense demeanor when it came to the material as well as his logical approach to the term paper that we needed to complete. He is also EXTREMELY eager to thoroughly answer any questions that students may have.
This is the best professor I have ever had in my entire college life. He has an extensive knowlege in the  course and makes it so simply. if u wanna learn all AEDECON in one class, take 4106

summary_comment: Dr. Day is highly regarded for his engaging and personable teaching style, making the class enjoyable and accessible with minimal textbook reliance. However, students note that while the lectures are helpful, significant study time is required, particularly for exams, which can be challenging and confusing due to their unique formats.

Ratings.comment: LOVED this class and Dr. Day. He is very laid back and personable. As long as you go to class and study, the course isn't too hard. He is always willing to help if you need it. He held my attention in class. Didn't use the textbook at all.  I would love to take him again if he wasn't leaving OSU:(

STUDY A LOT! The class average on our first exam (covering reproduction and digestive systems in different species) was a 67.3%. After that, the class average on his midterms (covering breeds of species) were C's. It's not too hard of a concept, but a lot of time needs to be put in this class. The lab, however, is an easy A.
Be sure to take his 200 class.  Not only is he a great lecturer and knowledgeable, but also he is much better than Dr Pfeffer.

I loved having Dr. Day. Going to his class was a lot of fun! The material is not too hard, but there is a lot of memorization to it. Just make sure you study his lecture notes and go to lecture so you understand the material. He's very helpful with anything you have questions on.

Dr. Day is a lot of fun. His quizzes and exams are super easy, if you just read his lecture notes (which are posted online). If you need this class for your major, definitely take him winter quarter instead of Peffer any other quarter...she's terrible.

He's also my freshman advisor so I'm alittle bias, but he's a great teacher. He only teaches this class winter qtr and I've heard not so good things about pfeffer. So try to fit hsi class if you can. We never used the textbook. Just study his lecture notes, he gives you everything you need. But you need to go to lecture to undertand it.
Day is a hell of a man and a pretty damn good professor too.  He is entertaining and helpful.  The way he does his tests can be confusing, but not so bad if you know the material.

the easiest class since at osu(3rd yr). don't buy the book. just kno all the #'s, ranks and %'s of everything in slides.  class only necessary if you want the ec 'pop quizzes' i only studied the night before the exam and got a's. IT'S MEMORIZATION!!! no applications. should not be difficult at all! there is partial credit. he's really nice too!

First of all, the exams were so convoluted I wanted to scream. Poorly worded, multiple answer questions graded without partial credit. Ridiculous. Plus, he wasn't even there for the last 2 weeks. Never answered emails, either. Even if you know the material, the exams are weird enough to confuse the hell out of you.

He's a nice guy and very knowledgeable, but the exams are confusing and difficult. The format is something like "choose all of the above that apply" or "use this answer more than once or not at all". Those are the most CONFUSING types of tests and it's very frustrating. Also, labs are mandatory but lecture is not.
Day was awesome and a lot of fun. really cool to be in class with and always laid back and good at explaining things. very interested in what he does. tests were pretty hard though!

Awesome prof. Don't buy textbook.  He tests straight from powerpoint slides and lectures. Very nice ad approachable.  Material itself is easy, just ALOT of info if you are a newbie to AS.  He test numbers alot too...percentages, figures, etc.  So after awhile they geta  little confusing.  Note of good advice, memorize E-V-E-R-Y-T-H-I-N-G on slides!

I had Day for AnSci 200 and also as my academic advisor my freshman year.  He is very approachble and laid back.  He only teaches in the winter- and is much easier than the other 200 profs.  As an advisor he was extremely helpful and made me feel like I was going to get through all my classes just fine.  Great guy in and out of class.
Great teacher, learned a lot. One of the best and most fun classes I have ever taken

Likeable prof. There aren't too many people who have taught for more than 5 years that manage to smile like he does: It's almost as if he's laughing (he probably is). The reason to show up to class? Extra credit. Most (98%) of the material on exams comes directly from the slides (but may require decoder ring). The labs make the class worthwhile.
Great teacher, really personable.  Dr. Day knows what he's talking about and knows how to teach it.  Funny and helpful
Very easy to understand and he will work with you to get the best grade for you and it is EASY.
Great teacher.  Really enjoyed his class.

Awesome teacher! If you want a guy that sounds like he just came off the farm, someone you can relate to, take Dr. Day! I thouroughly enjoyed his class. He was very enthusiastic about teaching and test very fairly. He definitely loves his livestock!
i havent had him for a class yet but i love him as my academic advisor.. he's def a cool guy.. quite funny
Great teacher, easy to get along with and more then willing to help you out.
His chest hair will probably distract you, but the class is very easy.  If you take notes and skim them before tests you should be ok.  Dr. Day is a nice guy who knows what he's talking about.
Great professor. Knows what he's talking about. Very helpful. Recommended to anyone.
No Comments
The class is interesting and Dr. Day is a good prof.  He's very clear, the tests are right from the material, and he obviously is interested in the subject matter.  great prof :)

Dr. Day is not only an good teacher but he tries to be nice guy which most teachers don't do. He knows alot about agriculture and you can tell. Dr. Day is very understanding and helpful if you are having problems.
I thought he was an excellent professor.  His experience showed through his lectures.
Like most of the Ag prof's, Dr Day is very helpful with everything, and his classes are easy going.

summary_comment: Professor Lobao delivers clear, rich, and informative lectures with high expectations for her students, though her long weekly evening classes and rigorous grading can be challenging. Despite some criticism for the lecture format, students find her knowledgeable and effective in helping them develop their skills.

Ratings.comment: Very long lectures, class in the evening once a week, pop quizzes and attendance checks.

Very clear instruction.  Well-versed in the literature and reports data and theory clearly.  Her classes are 1 day a week, so the lectures are long, but there is no filler in them.  Very rich and informative. There are very high expectations of students.  Do the work.  Put effort into writing.  She is a pro who will help you to develop.
Not that difficult, but interesting.  Would be better if it were on two days a week instead of one.  Not bad for a 1/2 undergrad/graduate class, rigorous enough for 600-level.
Dr Lobao is tough.  She is a very organized lecturer and we did have great discussions, but she is very critical of papers.

summary_comment: Dr. Hill/Grum is highly regarded for her engaging and supportive teaching style, earning her the title of "best professor" from multiple students. She is known for being clear, enthusiastic, and flexible, making her classes enjoyable and effective learning environments.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Hill/Grum is an amazing professor and I've had several classes with her now. She's a lot of fun and very up-front about what she expects from you on assignments. She's also pretty flexible if you have a problem.
Dr. Hill (Grum, now) is an amazing woman. She is understanding and gives many chances for extra credit. My favorite professor thus far.

Dr. Hill is probably the best professor I have had, hands down, during my whole undergraduate career at OSU. I wish I would have known about her earlier to take all her classes. She is a role model and an excellent professor. The class was pretty easy if you did all the assignments with time and read all the chapters. Would recommend this class!
This class gives pop-quizzes so come prepared every day. Dr. Hill is great though She''s very enthusiastic and super funny She''s also very much willing to answer any questions you may have.

Probably the nicest and most sincere prof in the college. Her lectures were clear and she made you reflect on the ways the class are carried out in real life. Never got bored during her lectures and homework was minimal. Plenty of picture breaks and she will always make time to answer your questions or say Hi around campus. LOVE HER!

Dr. Hill is a fun and very interesting teacher. You'll enjoy her lectures and come out of it feeling like you learned something. After taking her class I chose her as my advisor and I couldn't be happier. She's probably one of my favorite people ever.

Woman is a saint. She's sweet, hilarious and makes you feel at ease. Is very clear about what she wants you to know and exams are common sense. Some ppl feel like she's a little elementary, but honestly... with the classes you'll take as an animal science major - enjoy it while you can.

Dr. Hill is one of the best professors I've had to date. She's very clear about what she expects you to know and she doesn't throw in unnecessary material. She is super nice and very helpful. Her tests are mostly common sense as long as you go to lecture and pay attention. And her notes are online!

I absolutely adore this woman, she is my most favorite teacher to date. She is entertaining, interesting, and full of energy, sitting in her class is a delight. I want to take every course she teaches! I hope she'll be a mentor of sorts for me.

Best teacher that I have ever had! Great lecturer and amazing person inside the classroom and out. She's so relatable and personable, and loves her students. I am definitely going to take classes with her in the future. Take this class!

WONDERFUL lady! She has a wonderful sense of humor (especially for the age group she's teaching) and keeps things fun with a great deal of youtube use ;) The class is a breeze, yet you still want to go because it's interesting and practical information. Favorite class and professor yet! There is no reason to NOT take this class.
So nice and always enthusiastic.  She is understanding and willing to help.
By far the BEST professor I have had at Ohio State. Take her class and you will agree with me.

Amazing class! Fun topics, and Dr. Hill lives to teach the class. She is so enthusiastic about the class and that's what makes it really fun! Take this class, even if you're not an animal science major, you'll enjoy it!
Pretty good class for your social issues GEC requirement.
How could you NOT love Dr. Hill? She's a great teacher, EXTREMELY dedicated to students, and hilarious! The class was really interesting, too, I'm making sure to take more with her in the future!
willing to help students
Amazing teacher good humor and easy going,  the class is a breeze if you go to class you'll get an A no problem!  Very interesting material too :)
Great teacher and a nice human.Class is extremely interesting.The material and on line text well meshed and organized.
Awesome professor and awesome class!  She really cares about her students and wants them to learn/care about the material.  She's great!  Highly recommended!

Great proffessor.  Very excited, loves to help students.  Makes class enjoyable.  Tests are mulitple choice.  Info is easy to remember.  Always wants to help people. Go to class!no books just powerpoints.
Best teacher ive had since being at osu. Rarely attended and she was always understanding. RECOMENDED HIGHLY~

Dr. Hill is the most enthusiastic and excited professor I have ever had.  She couldn't be more excited to be teachin but sometimes gets a bit to into it and over explains things.  She is a joy to have class with and a wonderful human being with which to talk outside of class.

summary_comment: This professor is poorly regarded for her slow grading process and limited knowledge of the subject matter, resulting in underutilized class time and insufficient feedback for students. Classes frequently fall far short of the allotted duration due to her pacing.

Ratings.comment: She is extremely slow in grading, boring, has lack of knowledge over the content she presents, and therefore doesn't even begin to use the full class time.
This class barely went 30 minutes of the 55 allowed and was pretty simple.  She took forever in grading, so I couldn't tell how good my writing was until the class was over.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his approachable nature and willingness to help students, making the class easy and enjoyable. However, some students find his tangential discussions distracting and criticize him for a lack of focus on core material, suggesting the class may not be suitable for those seeking in-depth knowledge in marketing.

Ratings.comment: Great guy and good instructor. Willing to answer any questions you may have and he makes the class very easy.

Excellent.  Very interesting and well versed in the subject matter.  Likes students and is willing to take time to work with each student.  A really nice fellow to get to know and have for an instructor.  Warning, Prof. Thraen is not tolerant of dull and lazy students, those without any academic motivation.  If this describes you, stay away!
Goes off on tangents about things he wants to buy or has bought. Learned nothing in his class. Do not take if you actually care about learning Marketing. Has little respect for students and it shows.

summary_comment: Dr. Cano is highly regarded as an exceptional teacher and mentor, known for his clear explanations, supportive approach, and genuine desire to help students succeed. Students praise his ability to simplify complex statistical concepts and provide extensive feedback, leading to high course satisfaction and performance.

Ratings.comment: Most amazing man and mentor.

Dr. Cano is a wonderful teacher and a very kind man. He lays out his expectations and his purpose very clearly the first day, and as he says "will bend over backwards to help you" if you are willing to put the effort forth. All that means is show up to class and ask questions. Easily one of the Best Teachers I've ever had (as a senior)

Dr. Cano does a fantastic job explaining statistics in a simple way, and is very clear about what is on quizzes and exams. Spend time doing practice problems that you may have already completed in class and you will do well in this course.

Great teacher! He explains statistics so a normal person can understand it, tells u when u mess up on a quiz/test before you turn it in, gives lots of examples... lets just say he wants you to get an A!

I was hesitant about taking stats in general but Cano and Epps (TA) did an awesome job teaching the material. It's an easy A. The in-class assignments are just like the quizzes. They go around during quizzes and exams and tell  you if you have something wrong.

Man, I can't believe more people haven't rated this dude yet! HE BE THE BOMB. For real, for real. He wants you to get an A so bad, he practically erases wrong answers on your quizes and writes in the correct calculation. Unlike other stats classes, you don't have to memorize any equations. VERY VERY sweet man. I wish he was my uncle. DON'T BUY BOOK
He is great.  genuinely likes helping students..get him if you can
Fantastic.  People who don't want to work and excel will not like this professor.

summary_comment: Peg McMahon is highly regarded for her dedication to student success and comprehensive knowledge, making her classes both informative and engaging. Students consistently praise her approachable nature and supportive demeanor, recommending her across various disciplines.

Ratings.comment: Peg McMahon is one of those professors that doesn't just talk the talk, she walks the walk. When she says "students come first", she means it and her actions speak volumes. She is fantastically knowledgeable, clear and concise and an overall wonderful professor(and person). I highly recommend her for any class.
Nice lady. Easy class even though I wasn't an Agriculture major. Her exams are common sense. She makes it about as interesting as plant science can be. Definitely recommend for a science GEC
Great Prof!!!
No Comments
LOVE THIS LADY!!!!BEST PROF> AT OSU
Soooo nice... very helpful, always seems to be on her students' side.

summary_comment: Jim Chatfield is an exceptionally knowledgeable and engaging professor who is widely praised for his intelligence and sophistication in the classroom, though he occasionally veers off-topic. He is highly recommended, especially for students interested in natural sciences.

Ratings.comment: Jim Chatfield is not only one of my favorite professors at OSU, but he is one of my favorite human beings I've had the pleasure of meeting in my life. He is insanely knowledgeable on numerous topics and emanates intelligence and sophistication on the class. He frequently gets off topic but I guarantee you won't mind. Amazing professor.
Field and Woodland fungi. Great lecturer, alot of miscellaneous information. Highly reccommended if you are of the naturalist sort.

summary_comment: Dr. Southgate is perceived as a knowledgeable and caring professor, though his teaching style is generally considered dry and boring, with many students finding his lectures unengaging and his slides lacking visual appeal. Despite this, some students appreciate his sense of humor and find value in his challenging approach and high standards, particularly in his essay assignments.

Ratings.comment: I felt that a lot of the responses were very generous. He was nice, but very boring. His slides had no visual appeal and he was often off topic. I was really excited for this subject, but it was not enjoyable or interesting. Avoid taking his class. Also, papers were long and exams were very specific details, rather than applied concepts.

Looking  back, Dr. Southgate was one of my favorite undergrad profs. He is challenging, but that is the point of college. He will respect you if you respect him and the class. In other words, don't get caught on your smartphone or other distractions. He will teach you, but he will hold you accountable as well. These are all attributes in my mind.
The concepts studied in the class are very interesting, but he honestly makes them so boring. He drifts of about random stuff not related to the lectures, and the TA is so picky with grading.

Dr. Southgate is one of my all-time favorite professors. He may seem a little dry, but that is only because you do not understand/catch his very subtle sense of humor. I learned a lot in this class and found a wonderful, helpful mentor in Dr. Southgate.

Yes, Prof. Southgate's lectures are dry, boring, you name it. He's a very nice, sweet guy if you make an effort to get to know him. The key to the whole course are his essays! In order to do well on them, you have to discuss each point he asks you to write about. If you do, you'll get A's on his papers and a good grade in the course.

I felt like these posts were generous.He may be a nice guy.. However..His notes on carmen are inadequate. If you havnt had an econ class, good luck. lectures are random. Classes are painful to sit through-attend. mandatory. Also most people did okay on the papers..1st midterm avg was a D. No curve. May be I should have tried sucking up?

Really great teacher; very intelligent, good style, funny, but not too much... A dry subject, a lot of economics, but I love that. Second half of the course pretty deadly. One student got called out for going to sleep during class, and I had to privately empathize with him. All in all a wonderful guy who really cares about students and scholarship.

Cool guy, but very boring. The only thing too look forward to in class is when he talks about living in Ecuador. VERY economics- based. I wish I took Econ before I took this class. TA was very picky about grading the research paper. Midterm/final weren't too bad, but you definitely need to study and know economic concepts. I got a B+.

He's a nice guy, but is very interested in economics. I thought this was an international studies class, and ended up being pretty much all economics. I wrote my final paper, and got slammed because it had history and political aspects in it, which angered me a little considering its supposed to be about everything. Boring lectures too.

not a bad guy but the class can be a real bore during the second half if you don't enjoy the economic history of latin america.  The research paper can be a pain but the exams really arent that bad, the final was surprisingly easy to me.  In my opinion, I think an economics class should be a prerequisite, but i guess thats not dougs fault lol

The attendance policy is very strict - 3 absences and your grade drops 10%. Everything he says during lecture comes straight out of the textbook. The second half of the class is harder than the first; a lot of information to learn. He'll help you as much as he can if you just ask.
Funny guy. Advocates sending the Harlem Globetrotters to represent the US in the olympics. Fun class, slightly boring though.

he focuses solely on agriculture and economics, but doesn't teach anything else about latin america -- a little geography, no culture, only a little sociology. you write a paper on demography and one on history and he yaps about economics the whole time. if thats what you want, he's your guy. if not, then you should find another class.

He's a good teacher and really tries to help you understand the material. Yes, he's a little dry and boring sometimes, but if you ask for his help and get on his good side, not only will he love you, he'll give you a much better grade than you deserve. The class isnt that difficult, and everything is straight from the notes that he puts on Carmen.
He's really buring and you never REALLY know what he's gonna talk about next...
He's sooooooo boringggggggggggg.  Tests aren't all that hard, but they're really random though.
He's funny
booooooooooring.
No Comments
great teacher
very knowledgeable, good stories
Even though, this class was Intro to Latin America, he emphasized a lot in the economic parts.  He has interesting stories about his life in Ecuador.  His test is T/F though.
Kind of boring but if you even fake an interest in what he says, he perks right up and will love you forever. Smile a lot. He likes happy people.
The papers are insane on how picky his TA's are in grading them.  The Tests are T/F which you may or may not like.  Overall take a different class.
Southgate's a cool guy, and into it if you suck up.  Get on his good side and you are set for life. Makes Econ easy.

Professor Southgate is a nice guy but he does not explain anything he says very well.  The papers are hard because the T.A.'s are too picky over small things.  Overall, the class sucks and I would not recommend taking it!
boring lectures but decent guy

summary_comment: Professor Zerby is highly regarded for stimulating critical thinking and challenging students, making the learning process demanding yet rewarding. However, some find his lectures and tests challenging due to his teaching style and the lack of clear structure, while others praise his depth of knowledge and engaging teaching approach.

Ratings.comment: I've had zerby quite a bit over the years. He is a difficult professor that really stimulates you. He makes you think and does not spoon feed anything. I have really enjoyed having him and he is a great resource. If your a lazy student who does not put in effort or class participation you wont do well, otherwise you he is amazing

A horrible professor who is very unprofessional. He is difficult to understand, and thinks it's funny when he yells. His material is difficult, though it should not be. He expects you to understand everything on the tests but doesn't actually teach the material. Avoid taking his class if you can.

Huberus arrogance! Many are audio and visual and objective learners not artists an one time through does not make one a master Abook would be nice rather than the class clown ALso big rush one font size in exams tough enough to have to fish for fill in the blank
I think he is a great guy. He is really into what he does. He does expect you to know basic chem and bio. Overall he's fun and I look forward to going to that class every session.

He is very confusing in the way he lectures. He isn't that clear in what he wants you to know and what he doesn't want you to know. His slides are sometimes confusing to follow/take notes off of. His tests are hard unless you know every little thing that goes through his head. STUDY A LOT.

Awesome teacher. He doesn't test on anything he doesn't talk about in lecture. I loved him as a professor. Averages on exams were kind of low but I got A's on all of them and the final. Go to lecture and really know your notes and you will be fine :)

His lectures are interesting. Lots of material to be learned though. Very helpful professor. That being said, his tests might be a bit of a problem. Very detailed tests. Barely any multiple choices. Going to lecture will definitely help you out.
This professor will teach you more than any professor in the entire animal sciences program at Ohio State. If you stay on top of things in this class, there is no limit to the things you can learn.

Absolutely the best proffesor I have had in any class throughout my entire schooling career. He is the smartest man I have ever met. He conveys his passion for things to his students, which I think in turn makes his students want to learn more. Stimulating conversations, Witty remarks, Fun, and many realizations are to be had in any class of his

As a tenured professor I think it is plenty of time to set up slides and define a book for proper flow and enrichment.  It is near impossible to get everything out of class and grade in the subjective detail required only to be graded penal and objective at best.

Zerby is the straight A student's dream professor. He is stimulating,funny,spastic and brilliant. His quizzes and tests are challenging.He sort of makes you think you are flunking the whole quarter..and then you realize at the end you are right on top of it. He's not for the thin-skinned,inexperienced student. You have to study every day - no joke.

like state before, avoid him like the plague. He is a nice guy, who's lectures are actually entertaining, but his exam questions come out of no where... twice this quarter we would have an exam, and the next class day, he gives you a quiz over the most missed questions. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. -no book

Dr. Zerby keeps class interesting, and taught in a way that I remembered the material without a lot of studying. Go to class, pay attention, take notes, and ask questions. The only thing I didn't like is we never got to see our graded exams.
AVOID IF YOU CAN

A Complete explitive! If you don't like the written work submitted to you return the assignment 1 with feedback for corrective action Not HW 1& 2 together and say you are Plagiarizing everything like nosebleed if a book avail & gave a chapter student could read and follow &succeed it would be interesting. No organization of slides to follow

disorganized arrogant I AM THE ADULT not you SLOW to return written work pissed at class when sloppy HIMSELF old mateials claims to take job serious so review exams not on my time yours if in doubt no credit exact words or no credit

AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE  A LOT OF CRITICAL THOUGHT QUESTIONS WITH EXTREME OBJECTIVE ANSWERS AND VERY PENAL TOO IF IN DOUBT HE GIVES YOU ZERO CREDIT FOR A 5-10-to15 point question  RECYCLES old material claims to take job serious no curve open door office hour JOKE kilLLING PIG OR COW TAKES HOURS SO not avail travels INTL TOO RUSHES FINALS  explitive

The only material you have to study from is what you write down during lecture. He posts very little notes online. He talks way too fast. His exams are difficult and then he will have a pop quiz the day after a midterm over the questions a lot of people missed. He has no office hours. Seems to put little effort into teaching this class.

Zerby is by far my favorite professor.  He enojoys what he teaches which makes class fun.  His classes require a lot of outside study and review (which you may hate), but find a year later that you actually still know the material.  He is hard to get ahold of outide class, but is alwa willing to help out whenever he can to clarify a topic for you.

Awesome professor! Very interesting, keeps you awake. It really helped me in my biology classes I was taking at the same time, and in later nutrition classes. Actually funny, and easy to learn from. Made me actually want to take some meat processing classes!
Fast Talker, but knows his material.  Easy to approach for help if you need to.  Would take another class with him.

This is the most useless professor I have ever had and hope to ever have!  He has no office hours, he offers no help, he can not teach and he does not prepare you for the quizzes that he gives I did not get a terrible grade but I studied like it was a 5 hr course and got A's on all three exams and still ended up not getting the A how's that work?

he is interesting....to say the least.  you'll really get tired of hearing "It all makes sense" and "structure = function".  His tests are like finals on how you may need to prepare for them. I had expected my background to make this class easy but you need to know everything he tells you & Don't get me started on his pop quizes

I don't like him as a professor at all.  He speaks WAY too quickly, and gives you TONS of information and then says, you thought you needed to know that?  He gives nearly impossible pop quizzes, and don't even get me started on his pointless homework assignments or impossible tests.  I love this subject, too, so I'm bummed.

Dr. Zerby keeps the class fun and exciting.  This is a science based class that covers LOTS of material.  Be careful if your not an animal science major or have not had many animal science/biology classes.
Deffinitly knows what he's teaching, and he makes the class interesting.  Though he tends to put tricky quiestions on the exams, so read them over carefully.

Zerby is amazing- a little crazy at times, but he's able to keep everyone's attention and get the point of the day's lecture across very well.  Any class he teaches is definitely worth taking- he's very friendly, helpful, and fair.

Zerby is awesome-he's kinda hyper which keeps class interesting, and is fun to listen to.  His tests aren't too hard, but you have to memorize like everything he said in class to do well.  Cool class too
Dr. Zerby is very, very, very energetic and VERY interested in his field. If you're not awake when you first get to class~ you will be when you leave!
Great class, hard tests.  He expects alot from his students.
What can I say, Zerby is cool as hell.  A little hyper, keeps class interesting.  The man loves eggs.  Zerby Rocks!

He gets very excited about meat and teaching about meat. He also likes plenty of detail in test answers. There is no book for 250 ask lots of questions! Use as many journal references as you can find for your papers, he doesn't like internet refferences.

summary_comment: The professor is poorly regarded for lacking preparation and deviating from the syllabus, making the class confusing and redundant since all information was available online.

Ratings.comment: Very poorly prepared class and didn't follow syllabus dates.  Confusing when doesn't use syllabus.  Everything said during class was also online.

summary_comment: Jones is considered one of the least effective instructors due to his reliance on reading slides without additional explanation, lack of response to emails, and unengaging teaching style, making the class extremely boring. Despite the challenging material, some students find success through consistent attendance and asking for help, though overall his teaching quality is low.

Ratings.comment: There is no instruction with Jones; he simply reads off the slides, which are posted on Carmen. Could be because its his first quarter teaching the class. He doesn't respond to e-mails and has no regard for students. The set-up of the class certainly doesn't help any. Hands down, most boring Professor I've ever had.

Class is hard, and he doesn't explain that well. Most of the people I talk to in class don't understand what we are doing. Labs are easy and make up for test because they are not easy. You have to go to class and actually learn the material to do well. Very dry material, but he is willing to help if you take the time to ask. Don't fall behind!
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor is known for clear communication and a balanced workload, though his lectures can be dry. He strictly grades papers heavily on spelling and grammar, and frequently gives pop quizzes that test attentiveness.

Ratings.comment: Would give pop quizes-if you paid attention in class you would get the questions correct.
He is strict on grading papers...he takes 10 to 20 points off for spelling and grammar...i think that is too much!
Very boring, but easy.
He made this 3 credit hour course with just the right amount of work load...not too hard but enough so that you get something out of it. He's a clear speaker and will help you out if you need it.

summary_comment: Dr. Latshaw is highly regarded for his knowledge and engaging teaching style, making complex theories accessible and keeping classes interesting with light-hearted humor. Students find him very approachable and helpful, often praising his willingness to assist those who need extra support.

Ratings.comment: Get the notes from Uniprint and go to class.  This guy knows his stuff and provides a great foundation for the subject of nutrition.  He's very nice and approachable.

Really nice guy and very helpful. Very interesting class, required if you're an AnSci major. Labs are fun when there are activities to do. Notes are pre-printed, so it makes it easier to keep track. Highly reccommended!

Dr Latshaw is a great teacher, and he is VERY willing to help you out if you don't understand something. He starts class with a joke or a quip from the news and generally keeps it light-hearted and interesting. Super nice guy.
Good teacher,very good at explaining difficult theroies very fair,funny,really interested in teaching and his students
Good Teacher, Don't buy the text book you will only need the one from uniprint. Very fair very knowlegable funny too!

No book, very easy notes.  Go to class, gives a course packet.  Tests are easy but sometimes the questions are confusing.  Check your test over! Don't be afraid to talk to him.  Lab was easy.  Lots of points 10 quizzes, 3 tests not cumulative, Lab tests are more difficult.  Study, but not too hard. Tests are short answer and essay

What textbook?  :o)  I really enjoyed this class, the pace, the information.  Instructor was very open and it was clear that he cared about his students.  Even in this very large class it seemed he had time for everyone.  Exam Qs sometimes a bit cryptic but take good notes and study well and they should be easy to decode.
really nice teacher. well organized notes. class is not boring and does not cover to much material. nice guy.

Once you get beyond his lude joke, he's a great guy who is very esay to be around albeit a bit awkward.  If you push enough he will teach you what you deserve and you can get a lot out of it.  Don't be afraid to apporach him, he's a very easy going guy. And he sure know's his chickens.

i really didn't think he was that great of a teacher. the material wasn't too difficult to pick up on, but frequently i felt as though he though he was teaching human nutrition, rather than animal. all of his stories and jokes are a waste of time too. a lot more could have been taught with that time
He is funny to listen to and has good stories, but the notes are all over the place and he'll go off on random tangents.  The tests are easy howerver.
awesome professor!  lectures material well and also has clear notes to go with the lectures.  willing to help students all the time.

summary_comment: Dr. Boehm is an exceptionally knowledgeable and engaging professor who challenges students to excel while maintaining a supportive environment. His classes are described as both interesting and demanding, with take-home exams and papers that require significant effort but are ultimately rewarding.

Ratings.comment: Part of the final was take home, prof kept it interesting.  Only textbooks were some books to read that were mostly easy, interesting reads.  Easy class if you put forth the effort!

Scary smart. One of those rare teachers that expects a lot out of you, but also gives a lot. You do well because you want him to think highly of you, not because you're afraid of doing bad in his class. Excellent teacher!
Dr. Boehm cares.  Worked my ass off... no regrets.  I would consider changing my major to plant pathology if I wasn't so close to graduating.
Very knowledgeable about sujbect and good with students. Midterm was a take home and had a final paper and exam. Make sure to read because questions from readings will apear on exams.

I loved his bioterrorism class. If he does a take home exam it is very time consuming but putting in the extra effort is worth it. Very interesting class and very smart, funny teacher to have. Must take this class if in international studies.

Mike is awesome, if your willing to do some work, you will get an A. Final is not bad, midterm was very time consuming and exhausting. Class was interesting, great professor, I would absolutely recommend him.
The class is very interesting and it really draws me in. He is a stellar teacher and plant diseases rock!!!!!!!!!!!
he is amazing!!! I think he is really into what he teaches and that it really draws me in! The classes are really interesting and plant diesaes rock!!!
Professor Boehm is by far the best Professor I had while at OSU. If you can take his Bioterrorism class.
Cool guy. Class is fun and engaging. Final was kind of specific but not too hard. I definitely advise that you take a class from Mike.

I would not recommend this class to anyone unless they were extremely passionate about plant diseases. This is probably my worst experience so far at OSU. The TA's were helpful, but even they couldn't make you care about the content. Honestly. The midterm was a 7 page essay on plant diseases.

Stellar instructor.  Passionate about both subject matter and student learning.  One will learn more applied biology and micro in 401 than in Bio 113 and Micro 509.  We're still in contact, and I took this class back in '99.  Top-shelf.  Take any course he offers with my recommendation.
Good prof.  very passionate about subject...Tests are fair as long as u study and come to class

summary_comment: Dr. Pope is a knowledgeable and caring professor who emphasizes in-class content heavily, making the material straightforward but requiring diligent note-taking and studying. His classes can be challenging, especially without supplementary reading, but he is receptive to questions and willing to help students succeed.

Ratings.comment: This class was super hard. Dr Pope is a nice guy, but he speaks in fragments and likes to test us on things that he just casually mentions ONCE in lectures. I struggled a lot. I recommend reading the textbook because even if you watch the lectures multiple times and write down every word he says, you're still going to struggle. GOOD LUCK

The lectures are great. Lots of guest speakers. Homework assignment once a week. The homework is a little confusing but he goes over it with you and is very receptive to questions. The midterm was a scenario based on the homeworks and it was confusing at times but he is very helpful and will guide you through. Final project is a simple paper.

I love Dr. Pope's lectures. He knows his material and only uses powerpoint to add pictures/emphasis to what he is saying. Exams are fair. Come to lecture and write down/type everything he talks about. If you study your notes, you will do fine! No book needed.

The class isn't terrible and even interesting. The book isn't really necessary, either. Quiz grades are only pop quizzes so attendance is kind of important. The only grades are quizzes and 3 exams, so it's hard to get back to a good grade if you mess up one. Downside was that we had to skip the entire skeletal system due to time.

Fast paced class. Attendance not mandatory but he gives pop quizzes which he curves. Need to pay attention because most of what he says is on the exams. Not everything is on the slides so need to take good notes. He emphasizes important points. Seemed pretty nice & laid back, but expects you to study a lot

Dr. Pope is a pretty straightforward professor. Everything that is on the exams is stuff that he goes over in class. There's a lot of stuff to remember, but he won't try to trick you about it. Keep up with work and pay attention in class. He puts some effort into not failing students.

Dr. Pope is a prof who honestly cares about his students. If you're willing to learn and work hard then dr. pope is willingly to help you. The material is really straight forward but you may need to refer to your textbook and other resources to supplement your lecture notes. The huge volume of stuff to know requires the proper time management.

Eh. He's hot and cold; arrogant yet helpful, detailed yet not detailed enough sometimes. I used the book a lot when I felt he lacked, but overall his class is very straight forward and easy to pass with GOOD time management and using his end of term lists. Listen to his repro rants - they all become bonus Qs.

Wonderful guy! Has a lot of fun teaching and includes cute/funny little pictures for fun. Good sense of humor. Memorize ALL terms, as exams are detailed. If you are familiar with his "end of unit" lists, you'll do fine. Generally curves each test 5-10 points, plus 10 bonus questions per test. All around great guy and professor for learning anatomy!
Took the honors course with labs.  This prof is great and knows his stuff.  He looks like John Cleese and is willing to work with his students.  I highly recommend his class.

Take an exam every two weeks, keep best four out of five.  10 bonus questions on each exam.  None are cumulative. Definitely print out the slides and go to class, and fill out the 'final list of terms' he gives before each exam. Can also read through past exam questions that he provides.  He will throw out questions on each exam to increase avg.

All around wonderful person.  His jokes are actually funny once in a while.  LOTS of notes to study... don't wait until the last minute like I did.  Easiest to read through notes start to end and just understand everything.  Friday midterms suck, but only 4 count.  No final and none are cumulative (thank god!).  Recommended! : )

Great teacher.  He moves very fast through lecture, so make sure you come to class prepared.  Reading the book helps a lot.  He gives you 5 tests and you get to drop your lowest.  Very nice and accommodating.  He doesn't curve your final score, but will  slightly curve each test (he removes the questions that not a lot of people got right).

My favorite prof by far!!He is very good at explaining hard concepts and you can tell he loves teaching! Very approachable and helpful. He adds lots of pictures to help clarify and funny ones as well. The class was hard because of so much info but exams were straight fwd. In order to do well you have to go to class... which I actually enjoyed!

The class is fast paced and considerably harder than Animal Sci 310.  The two midterms are striaghtforward if you study the lecture notes, but the comprehensive final is a killer.  Lab was interesting and fairly easy.  This is a very informative class, great for prevet students.

The most accommodating professor on the earth: If there is something you think will help improve your ability to learn, he'll make it happen no matter how silly. The class can be easy if you 1) print out the slides and 2) write your notes next to the pertinent images on the slides, and 3) recompile those notes in some way to prepare for the exam.

Very likeable.  You have to go to class though and pay attention.  His side stories appear on exams.  Allows you to drop one out of five exams, so if you like your grade by week eight, you no longer have to go to class.

Wonderful prof. He is very smart and nice. The class is challenging just bc it is anatomy. You have to put time in to it to get an A. I think he explained everything really well and he is always willing to help you out if you dont understand. Writes great recommendations for vet school!

Very boring lectures!  Puts 17 pictures of the same thing in his slides - what a waste.  His specialty is repro, but he taught the class things that were WRONG - he said that mitochondria are inherited paternally, and didn't know about meiosis.  This class was too easy, I feel unprepared for future classes because of Dr. Pope.

Very good teacher.  Study everything he says.  Tests are a little difficult.  You should have some anatomy backround before taking this class.  If you are happy with your grade by the 8th week you don't have to go to class anymore.  Very nice teacher, wants you to learn.  Repro section is difficult.

summary_comment: Dr. Whittington is highly regarded for her caring nature and engaging teaching style, with many students praising her as the best professor at OSU and recommending her class. While some find her lectures valuable and the class life-changing, others note issues with the material and grading fairness.

Ratings.comment: Dr Whittington is super sweet! She genuinely cares and is an absolute joy to know. The class is long but like she says the best 2 1/2 hours of your week". It's a class that basically teaches you to be a decent person so show up it'll be cool.

Prepare to learn stuff that you will go with your grave. This class is very interesting, life-changing(you become a better person),revealing, enlightening, & surprising. This is one of few class that I looked forward to. Dr. Whittington is the best professor in OSU. I recommend this class and Dr. Whittington to anyone and everyone attending the OSU
She cares about the students, but the material is pretty bad. She did her best though
Outstanding teacher who actually cares about students.
I got more out of the book than any of her lecture-when she doesn't have the grad student lecture. The class could be valuable if it wasn't taught/oversaw by her.
She gets her favorites and they always get the best grades.
No Comments
Loved her!

summary_comment: Dr. Kuber is widely regarded as an excellent professor with a wealth of experience, known for his engaging lectures, sense of humor, and willingness to help students. However, his effectiveness as a teacher varies; while some students find his classes enjoyable and valuable, others struggle with his expectations and the lack of consistent collaboration between instructors.

Ratings.comment: Update 2020: Dr Kuber and his lectures have aged like a fine wine
Not as good in lecture as Zerby but very knowledgeable.  Not too bad on the eyes either!

Dr. Kuber is great. He's a good lecturer, has a good sense of humor, and he'll answer any question as best as he's able to. I really enjoyed him, but you have to study. No ifs, ands, or buts about it. Look over notes everyday becuz he expects you to learn them. Great prof, though, and not that bad to look at either :D

Not that bad of a class; Dr. Kuber was a decent teacher and kept dry material as interesting as he could. Class was taught by 2 different people, and it was obvious they didn't collaborate on lectures... when Kuber made his exam it was over stuff the other guy never covered!! Maybe compare your notes sometimes, guys....

Dr. Kuber is an excellent professor with loads of experience as is Dr. Zerby.  Both are extrememly willing to help you if you take the time to meet with them.  They have this idea that we should actually think and use our own heads-crazy I know.  Take the time to get to know these professors-it will make things so much easier.

I HATED Kuber. The notes were either missing or in the wrong order. He NEVER responds to emails so don't expect help from him and he's never available. He told us he might not have time to teach one of the days and we were like are you serious? you're scheduled to teach this class. For those who are in the AnSci major, just bite the bullet on this
Wow!  Very  cool professor clear and good to look at!

He's a whole lot better than Dr. Zerby but is still pretty much useless when it comes to actually teaching, both of the professors couldn't care less about their students they don't even try, they don't even have office hours.  Kuber at least is reasonable in what he expects unlike the "other one" teaching the course.  Don't take this class!
Good teacher- seems to care about his students and their success
AWESOME PERSONALITY. If only more people were like him the world would be a better place. If there is ever a sign that reads "Helpful" one should hang his picture under it.
May be a little boring to listen to sometimes, but makes up for it by being good to look at.
So what he's not as exciting as Dr. Zerby... He's SOOOO good to look at.
No Comments

His notes don't follow a logical order, and he is very dull when lecturing.  You never know whether he tells you something because he wants you to know it, or because it just happens to be slightly related to the class topic.  His powerpoints are not very helpful.  This class would be better with a book instead of teachers.

summary_comment: This professor is known for setting challenging exams and requiring significant effort to succeed, though students often find the grading fair in the end. Despite varying opinions, many acknowledge that the class is demanding yet rewarding, with those who persist reporting substantial learning gains.

Ratings.comment: You start the course off with him telling you that you are going to get between 30 to 60 on his exams and more than likely he will curve the class up to an 83 percent but it is up to his discretion on what he wants to do. Be prepared to work three pages ahead in the notes because that is where he gives extra credit for having the pages completed.
hard class but really cares about his students

He will definitely make you work for your grade. The class was harder than I had anticipated it and his teaching method is strict. I will day that I learned a lot from him but you must go to class everyday!
Difficult class, some what unmotivational due to dismal exam grades. Grading turns out fair in the end.

I've graduated from OSU now but this was one of my best professors. I thought I was failing the class because it IS a hard class, but the grades are fair. I learned so much. He's a bit odd, but very smart so make sure you see past his quirks.

I'm somewhat appalled at the comments from the other reviews.  This man is a brilliant teacher, you're just upset that he made you work.  You have to work hard; Carl is great at providing a rich learning experience every session.  Two thumbs up, my only regret is that I'm a student in another department.
He is an idiot and should not be teaching.
Wow, Zulauf is a rambling old man.  He made easy concepts very confusing.  Don't take his class.
Hard teacher but learned quite a bit from him

summary_comment: Pablo Jourdan is an excellent professor known for his deep commitment to student learning, encouraging a thorough understanding of course material rather than mere memorization. His lectures are detailed and challenging, fostering a robust educational experience that prioritizes building on prior knowledge and achieving a comprehensive grasp of the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: If I were a professor I would want to be like Pablo. He really wants you to gain a deep perspective and not just memorize a couple things.

Pablo Jourdan really wants you to understand the material of his class and asks you to build on prior knowledge. His lectures are thorough, so expect a lot of detail coming your way. Overall a very caring professor that wants to see his students be successful, but his class is very challenging. I have learned a lot from him.

summary_comment: Gina is an excellent instructor who consistently goes above and beyond to support her students' success. She is highly recommended for her caring nature and dedication to education.

Ratings.comment: Gina is a great instructor and she goes out of her way to help students succeed. Loved the group project experience in class and learned a lot about sustainability.
Gina is super nice and caring! She's always going the extra mile for her students. I would highly recommend taking any class with her!

summary_comment: The professor is known for making his class extremely easy, with straightforward assignments that can be completed with minimal effort, resulting in high grades. While some students appreciate his passion and care for their success, others find the class boring and feel it lacks depth, viewing it more as busywork rather than a valuable learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Class is super easy and he really cares about his students. He is passionate about the subject and believes that his class is important to your success. Assignments are easy and as long as you put forth effort you will get an A.
Straightforward class and subject matter. It seems easy and you could likely do well with just your own personal knowledge but he does a good job of elaborating on things and adding depth to topics.

You literally show up to class, get the weekly assignment, and do it.  Then you do the assignments that are in the syllabus, which I think there were a total of five.  Super easy.  Lectures are very boring and feel like a waste of time, but you get the assignment and it's an easy A.

He was not that bad of a person, but the class as a whole was bad. Really bad. It was a bunch of busy work and it was really easy, but I felt insulted to have to take the class. He takes way too long to explain overly obvious things like "communication in leadership" and he really thinks it is a helpful class...and again. It is definitely not.

summary_comment: Dr. Cochran's class is demanding, with a heavy workload that may not align with the expectations of a 3-credit course, and while he is helpful and provides feedback, the assignment volume is considered excessive by many students. Lectures can be dry, and the focus on 4-H can feel disconnected from broader youth organizations, though some find his assistance and clarity in grading helpful.

Ratings.comment: If you don't like a multitude assignments at one time, this isn't the class for you. Dr. Cochran is helpful and provides feed back, but expects far too much of his students working for a mere 3 credit hours. Not all assignments have relevance to the future of most students.
Graham was very helpful. He can be pretty strict on grading, but overall he was easy to understand.

For a 3hr class-way too much work. The reading/projects were ridiculous. Focuses on 4-H-even though there are millions of other youth organizations. Tons of reading with a reflection :( every class.Changes due dates on things alot-then when you get confused he takes a huge hunk off your grade.Not a very interesting speaker.

summary_comment: Professor Watts presents information in an engaging and practical manner, particularly useful for those interested in sales and HR, but his exams are challenging due to detailed questions and attendance requirements. His classes, especially early morning ones, can be difficult to stay engaged in, and while homework is not overly difficult, there are significant grading discrepancies, such as strict grammar expectations despite his own errors.

Ratings.comment: Second class I have taken with him as a teacher and same layout just different subject matter.  Homework isn't hard, tests are tricky because of the small details in a the questions. 2 Exams. 1 Final. 8 HW assignments. 2 Quizzes. 3 Participation Grades. Brings in guest lectures.

Prof Watts was a decent enough professor. He presented the information in an interesting way and was usually pretty funny. It was just difficult to engage in lecture because both classes with him were at 8am. He did a really good job at making the lecture into something you could use in the real world. If you're going into salesHR, take his class.

Where to begin? I specifically asked him if certain material was on the exam. He said no, then I took the exam and there was a lot from that material. Homework is due before you learn the lecture. The book will be your saving grace. He takes off a lot of points for grammar, yet has many grammar mistakes on his slides and assignments.
Good Class. Experience of Professor is obvious

The class was okay. the course content is common sense, but his exams require some time & effort in studying. he offers 1pt extra credit for attendance throughout the quarter which helps for missed pts on exams. you have to do 3 EASY papers 1-2pgs and a interview paper. but I didn't interview anyone and just wrote a bunch of stuff & got an A.

summary_comment: Dr. Smith's classes are generally considered easy with high pass rates, though her teaching style is largely seen as uninspired, with many students noting that she reads directly from slides. While some find her approachable and helpful, others describe her lectures as boring and her exams as unpredictable and difficult to prepare for accurately.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Smith was nice, but an uninspiring lecturer. She read directly off of the slides. Otherwise, I found her class to be pretty easy. She offered extra credit. The class averages were a bit low on the exams (around 70s), but if you study, you should do well (A's).

Her lectures are unnecessary and extremely boring. She reads straight from the powerpoints during class. The averages on the tests were in the C range, but if you study at all her tests are pretty easy. It is a boring class but an easy A.

Worst ideas ever if you want to take this class! Her exams are nothing like her power points or ask ridiculous questions about arbitrary material such exact numbers that were not even in her notes. HATED this class. Save yourself and do not take it. And her TA is just unbearable to deal with.
Took the online class and it's really easy. Don't bother with the study guides, just memorize the powerpoints the day of the test and you'll get an A.

I'm not a big online class person, and this class didn't change my mind much.  There's quite a bit of information, and the study guides she puts up don't match very well with what's on the exams.  I'd recommend taking this class in person if you can.
Very cheerful woman; she will brighten your day!  It's a really easy class and it only meets once a week.  If you have questions she goes out of her way to answer them!

DON'T BUY THE BOOK. WILL EASILY GET A W/O IT. Hilarious lady, made a semi-interesting class so enjoyable to attend because you never knew what was gonna come out of her mouth and how she was gonna make it relevant. Topics of interest include the biggest loser, her exasperation at the serving size of ice cream being a 1/2cup,and oprah. LEARNED A LOT

Very easy class! It's once a week, and theres a quiz a week, if you do them you'll get an A. Shes an okay teacher, she gets off topic and over explains a lot, but shes very helpful and always very nice. She's also the head of the dietetics department, so keep in touch with her!
nice easy class. Good Teacher
class is very easy ..easy exams but class is boring She talks too much about her poor husband not very plesant...she even tells u the color of her ****..

She makes lectures very interesting! She knows her stuff, and she teaches very well! She cares a lot about her students and pays attention to any concerns or questions you might have. Take human nutrition with her!

I also had her for 310.  She is the head of the Dietitics department and is very willing to write letter of recommendation or anything else you need.  She is a great contact to have for references, ect.
The online class is easy. You don't need the book, everything is right out of her lecture notes. The projects sucked, but were really easy too.
agreed.  online class was easy.

This was an online class, and it was probably the easiest class I have ever taken. Don't even bother with the study guides or even reading the book. Just read her online lecture notes and take the quizzes. The test are so easy. It's really an easy A.
Very nice prof, but class is extremely long and boring.  Have to go to class to get notes, but the exams were pretty easy.
She is so nice and understanding.  Always willing to help you out.  Test are just off my notes from class, so DON'T buy the book.  Take the FINAL you will get an A.
She is sooooo cute and funny! The class is so easy but super boring. You'll do great if you go to class and take notes. The tests are pretty much only over the lecture.
She is soo funny. thank goodness cause the class is boring.. but if you need a science take this one with her cause she'll keep u awake.

Easiest class I've ever taken in my entire life.  Don't buy the book, it's $120, and you can't return it.  Let someone else buy it, then use their CD for the assignment - you don't need to read from the book. Just go to lecture and take notes.

summary_comment: Dennis Albery is an exceptional professor known for his deep knowledge of the subject matter and his ability to inspire passion in his students. He is highly regarded for his dedication to student success and availability, making complex topics accessible and challenging students to excel.

Ratings.comment: Excellent professor. Had a knack for instilling his passion for the industry into his students.
Knows his stuff, and challenges people to do things.
Great instructor.  Will be missed at OSU when he retires.
CSM students will suffer when he retires. Dennis is the CSM program
Puts students first.
No Comments
No Comments
great job
Dennis Albery is one of the best instructors at Ohio State. He is always available to help and presents the information in a way that is easy to understand.
Extremely helpful, Dennis Albery goes out of his way to help his students, and is the reason why this CSM is so strong at Ohio State
He is very good at teaching by example.  I learned so much in this class by the way he showed us, hands-on how to do things.  He was very down to earth and easy to learn from.

summary_comment: No comments available

This professor is highly regarded for his accommodating approach and ease of grading, allowing students to complete assignments even with the wrong edition of the textbook. Students find him very generous with high grades, achieving near-perfect scores with minimal effort.

Ratings.comment: Took online class. Bought the wrong edition for the book and he tailored the assignments so that I could do them. Really great guy, also an easy easy A. Think I finished with a 98% while I probably put in an hour a week towards the weekly assignment. SHOW ME THE MONEY!

summary_comment: The professor offers a relatively easy grading system with minimal in-class instruction, relying heavily on students' ability to use notes and books during tests and providing significant extra credit for attending review sessions. While the class is easy to pass due to open-book exams and straightforward homework, it lacks depth in teaching and quick pacing, making it challenging to gain substantial knowledge.

Ratings.comment: There are only 2 tests and he lets you use your notes and books so it's very hard not to do well. There are 4 homework assignments during the whole semester and are a lot of points so it is important to do well on them. He doesn't really teach you how to do the problems in class so go in to see him and ask for help because he will go over it with u

You won't learn a whole lot, but the equations are in the book, the homework is fairly easy, and he gives a lot of bonus points. Just showing up to midterm and final exam review days gets you an automatic 25 extra credit points put towards your final overall course grade. The midterms and final are open note, book, homework, everything. Very easy!!

This class isn't very easy to follow, and you will not learn very much at all. The professor moves through material quickly and uses a lot of terms and variables without giving very much explanation. However, he does help with homework questions and the midterms are open everything.
A very easy class but you will probley not learn a whole lot.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his expertise in agribusiness finance, delivering challenging yet accessible content through open note and book tests. Known for his approachable nature and engaging lectures, students find him both informative and enjoyable to learn from, though attendance is not strictly necessary for success.

Ratings.comment: This was a beginning agribusiness finance class.  The tests were really difficult but open note, open book.  If you need help, don't be afraid to ask him.  Really cool guy and fun to listen to him lecture.  Don't need to show up to lecture to pass.

summary_comment: Dr. Thompson presents a challenging yet comprehensive curriculum that moves quickly, making consistent attendance crucial. While his lectures can be dry and sometimes difficult to follow, he is approachable both in and out of class and covers a lot of material efficiently, though he could improve in answering questions during class time.

Ratings.comment: The material is sometimes hard to follow, but he does go slow.

It can be dull in the class and you may fall asleep but I suggest not falling asleep because you will miss some important information. If you don't show up to class you will be kinda far behind because one thing leads right to another and he can cover a lot of material in one day.

Dr. Thompson does a decent job at presenting the information but doesn't always do the best job at answering questions in class. He's a board-writer too so don't expect lecture slides. Very approachable.

In class, the Dr. Thompson is somewhat dry, but knows the material very well. Is very approachable before and after class, never went to office hours, but I assume he is the same way there. Tests were usually easier than he claimed they would be, but they cover a lot of material at once. Everything he covers on tests are from in class, but sometime

summary_comment: The professor received negative feedback for the Applied Water Management class, indicating poor teaching quality and inconsistent attendance, which left students with minimal learning during the semester.

Ratings.comment: Applied Water Management class was the title and he wasn't very good at all.  The skipped multiple classes without telling people and I barely learned anything the whole semester.

summary_comment: The professor effectively communicated complex material and utilized class time efficiently, providing clear instruction, pop quizzes, and extra credit opportunities, making the course highly recommended and conducive to rapid learning.

Ratings.comment: She was great, difficult class material but she did a good job at explaining everything

Great use of class time. Clear material. Clear grader. Pop Quizes. Extra credit opportunities available. Class structured well and is conducive to learning a lot of material in a short amount of time. Highly recommended. Would take again.

summary_comment: Dr. Wali is a highly respected professor known for his passion and dedication to his subject matter, which he effectively communicates to help students become better citizens. His classes are generally considered easy with multiple-choice exams, provided students keep up with readings and attend lectures; however, some students found his teaching style and exam questions challenging.

Ratings.comment: Great Professor and Educator with passion for his subject and helping students learn and be better citizens of this world.
No gimme GEC, but Wali is an awesome prof and really helpful if you need it. Textbook written by him so everything in it was fair game.

Very passionate about the subject. He's interesting so it makes the class interesting. Exams are all multiple choice and fairly easy. He slides in questions that you'd only know if you had read the book or had gone to lecture so try to keep up with the reading AND go to class.
Easy class. Attend lecture and read about 3 chapters a week and you'll get an A. Exams are all multiple choice.

Great class topics. Very well rounded and diverse class for anyone majoring in environment or animal related areas. Wali is a sweet little man. He is a bit old fashioned but he really does love his students and picks really helpful TA's for your recitation. The TA's will gladly catch you up if Wali goes to fast. You need to read 4-5 chapters a week

When I first took Dr. Wali's 201 class, he certainly earned my respect. I eagerly signed up for ENR756. Totally changed my mind about him. The class was useless. It was all student presentations on scientific papers about restoration--and Wali took every chance he got to rip people apart to make himself look good. He's a smug, pretentious ass.

I really enjoyed this class. Wali is a very knowledgeable teacher. You will learn a lot from his lectures. His lectures might not cover exactly what is on the midterms, but recitation and the book help. If you try in this class and take it for what its worth you will be fine.

Wali is clearly passionate about this subject but his lectures are rediculously scattered and the only way you can understand the material is via recitation and the book. Also, this class is in BFE so it is a pain to get to!!
Hmm quote lots of stuff, and know who wrote what you're quoting and their background. Do this two or three time, and you're in there like swimwear!! A'sville baby!

This guy is a great prof. He lets you ask questions last 5 min every lecture, recitation is all you need to pass, but lecture is extremely interesting and full of facts. Worth the time in going. Read the book and attend rec. and work--you will get an A.
Read, Speak up and revise revise revise your papers BEFORE you turn them in and you will do great!
Class is almost entirely student taught. Dr. Wali is interesting to listen to but there isn't much to learn from this class. Good luck getting an A; I'm not sure anyone did.
Makes a should-be-boring GEC class very interesting and relevant.

Explains everything very clearly, nice guy, and explains how to find solutions to the problem, not just complain about the problem.  Tests are all multiple choice, everything you really need to know you will learn in recitation and go over in quizzes there.  Interesting class, cares about teaching.

Easy A if you come to class and participate.  However, largely a waste of time; no teaching involved, didn't learn anything, and its a shame because this kind of course is really needed here.  He means well, I suppose, but you get the feeling he's just coasting here.  Felt cheated.
Knowledgeable and interesting. Very good at explaining tough concepts. Be sure to attend class because he has a habit of not going by the syllabus.
Excellent educator! Dr. Wali WANTS students to learn and helps all he can. He even communicates with students after the end of the quarter. Very interesting content, and very current. Stimulating!
Very good.  The class was interesting, and he was very clear in the lectures.

He really cares about his students.  Sometimes he is a little difficult to understand, but the TA's clear everything up.  His tests are not difficult.  The text doesn't need to be read, but you definitely need to go to class to pass.

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality is extremely poor, as evidenced by students finding the class nearly impossible due to outdated overheads and an inability to answer quiz questions or provide meaningful assistance.

Ratings.comment: This class is tough no matter who teaches it, but when your professor just shows you overheads from the last guy who taught this class it's almost impossible. When we took quizzes I had no idea that we had talked about these types of problems. He couldn't answer questions either. Just down right terrible.

summary_comment: Professor Penn is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for breaking down complex material into manageable units and providing challenging yet fair assessments. He is also praised for his knowledge, enthusiasm, and relatable personal insights, making his classes both informative and engaging.

Ratings.comment: Professor Penn is quite literally the most amazing professor ever. In the whole world.

He taught the class material in three well-defined units, and rather than having a cumulative final exam, we had one test over each of the three units. The tests were challenging, but Professor Penn does a really nice job at breaking down all of the material that he wants you to learn. Overall, Professor Penn is very caring and intelligent.
Smart teacher and just starting out so he is rough around the edges.

Very knowledgable in the subject area. Jerrold is very enthusiastic when it comes to teaching and wants the students to get the most out of the class which makes it enjoyable. Takes attendance via Poll Everywhere. His personal soapboxes are very relatable and full of Great advice so listen up. Will help any student and loves feedback during class.

Mr. Penn is extremely knowledgable about his field. This comes into play often when he does what he calls "Soapboxes" when he essentially takes a chunk of class time to lecture on unrelated topics such as personal finance, investing, etc. Those were very interesting and I would take a class solely on those. 3102 material was very dense.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his clear and thorough teaching methods, with most students finding the material well-covered and exams similar to practice tests. However, some find his lectures dry and prefer practical engagement, while others note his strictness during labs and exams.

Ratings.comment: He was very clear that the class grade was going to consist of 3 tests. If you know all of the questions on the study guide you should get an A. Most tests will have extra credit. Fill out the study guides, turn them in for review, fix and memorize for the exam and you will get an A. Dry to listen to in class so fill the study guides out in class
A really great guy! Show up to his lectures and you'll never need the book and be prepped for the exams. Exams are easy. Very similar to the sample exams.
I found Metzger was very interested in teaching but if you do not understand something in the slightest he will ream you for it on labs and finals.
Highly reccommended. Very thourough coverage of material. Good lecturer, although probably not as interesting if you are not into plants.

I did not care for Jim at all. He was very unpleasant to listen to, gave no effort to help students outside of class. I went to his office hours, and he acted like I was wasting his time. He had no intentions of helping me in any way.

Jim is a great lecturer and adviser.  Ask questions, and he'll clarify using a varietiy of real-life examples.  Extraordinarily intelligent man, and not arrogant about it.  I call the course somewhat easy not because of the material, but because the style of material delivery is top-shelf.  Has a sense of humor and cares about student learning.
Very fine teacher.  His interest in students and material is nice to see in a predominantly research-oriented, students-are-invisible, school.  One of the best in the Department.
a genuinely nice man, wants you to do well,  not exactly  interesting material though
No Comments

summary_comment: Dr. Dorrance's teaching is marked by significant organizational issues, often leading to delayed lecture postings and unclear assignment deadlines, which disrupts the syllabus and creates confusion. Students frequently report receiving no response to their emails when seeking clarification.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Dorrance has a tendency to be very unorganized. Some of the time it would take until the weekend or at the end of the week before the lectures were posted. When this happened the syllabus would be thrown off and there was not a clear agenda of when assignments were due. Also, when I did have questions I usually did not get an email back.

summary_comment: The professor is generally viewed as a nice instructor who starts with easier tasks but gradually introduces more complex assignments like podcasts and PSA videos. However, students found her unclear in delivering criteria, which made it challenging to succeed without attending classes regularly, as bonuses are awarded for attendance.

Ratings.comment: This class was very easy in the beginning, but as you progress throughout the course you begin to stop just writing papers and actually have to create other things such as a podcast and PSA video. Overall, she was a very nice teacher but I had trouble because she didn't deliver criteria clearly always. Don't skip class bc in the end she gives bonus
